sentences.english: And he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲就把上泉下泉赐给她。

sentences.english: The water then flows out of the side of the valley to form a spring.
sentences.chinese: 然后，水从山谷坡上流出，形成泉。

sentences.english: I read this article to Izumi, who was sitting across from me.
sentences.chinese: 我把这篇报道读给泉听时，她正坐在我对面。

sentences.english: The amount of charges on Lightwell has been increased to 10.
sentences.chinese: 光明泉的使用次数被增加到10次。

sentences.english: Roses shave thorns, and silver fountains mud;
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花有刺，银色的泉有烂泥。

sentences.english: Bantang mineral spring is a hypefthermy sulfate radon spring.
sentences.chinese: 半汤矿泉为高温硫酸盐氡泉。

sentences.english: I took a deep breath, gazed up at the sky and turned to Izumi.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了一口气，凝视了一下天空，然后转向泉。

sentences.english: Izumi and I had a strictly compartmentalised yet totally intimate relationship.
sentences.chinese: 泉和我保持着一种泾渭分明却又亲密无间的关系。

sentences.english: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters , and streams from Lebanon.
sentences.chinese: 你是园中的泉，活水的井，从黎巴嫩流下来的溪水。

sentences.english: If the roof drops beads, drops deep pool ding-dong sound, it is called "supernatural spring."
sentences.chinese: 洞顶水滴若珠，滴入深池叮咚作响，名曰“灵异泉”。

sentences.english: So Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
sentences.chinese: 迦勒就把上泉下泉赐给她。

sentences.english: After that, the spring on Nine Dragon Hill became officially the Second Spring Under Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 从此，九龙山泉水，便定为“天下第二泉”。

sentences.english: Stephen is the snow to drink, eat their own species of rice and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 喝的是雪花泉，吃的是大米饭和自家种的青菜。

sentences.english: Trees are thriving and vigorous, while springs flow murmuring and look marvelous.
sentences.chinese: 木欣欣以向荣，泉涓涓而始流。

sentences.english: Of watching up thy pregnant lips for more.
sentences.chinese: 期待着你那圆润的双唇再吐音泉。

sentences.english: Yanhe spring karst water system is one of the famous springs in North China.
sentences.chinese: 山西省延河泉岩溶水系统是我国北方岩溶大泉之一。

definition: mouth of a spring or fountain
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
